item.title: 罗马尼亚是欧洲的 "农民之国"，但其农作物正在枯萎
item.description:
罗马尼亚的农场约占欧盟农场总数的三分之一，日益枯竭的水供应正在危及该国在食品供应链中的作用。【原文：

Romania accounts for about a third of all farms in the EU and depleting water supplies are jeopardizing the country’s role in the food supply chain.

】

item.title: 通胀回升，波兰将再次维持利率不变
item.description: 在 9 月份通胀率攀升至 2024 年新高后，波兰将维持利率不变。【原文：Poland is set to keep interest rates unchanged after inflation climbed to a fresh 2024 high in September.】

item.title: 人民币期权押注显示对中国经济刺激影响的担忧
item.description: 如果人民币期权赌注能提供任何指引，那么市场对中国刺激政策的欣喜情绪有可能迟早熄灭。【原文：Market euphoria around China’s stimulus blitz is at risk of sputtering sooner rather than later, if yuan option wagers are any guide.】

item.title: 台风克拉森缓慢袭台，航班受阻
item.description: 台风克拉森带着强风和暴雨向台湾袭来，风暴将于周四早些时候登陆台湾，并可能导致台湾 2.5 万亿美元的股市连续第二天休市。【原文：Typhoon Krathon tracked toward Taiwan with strong winds and heavy rain, with the storm set to make landfall early Thursday and potentially keep the island’s $2.5 trillion stock market closed for a second day.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击令战争风险溢价回升，石油熊市面临考验
item.description: 伊朗对以色列的导弹袭击正在考验人们对油价普遍持有的看跌观点，这次袭击引发了人们对中东紧张局势进一步加剧可能导致供应中断的担忧。【原文：Iran’s missile attack on Israel is testing widely held bearish views on oil prices, with the strike raising concerns over potential supply disruptions from the Middle East should tensions increase further.】

item.title: 菲律宾对 Netflix 和 HBO 服务征收 12% 的增值税
item.description: 菲律宾总统小费迪南德-马科斯周三签署了一项法律，对包括 Netflix、HBO 和迪斯尼在内的非居民数字服务提供商征收 12% 的增值税。【原文：Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. on Wednesday signed a law imposing a 12% value-added tax on non-resident digital service providers including Netflix, HBO and Disney.】

item.title: 香港中资股大涨，开发商股领涨
item.description: 在香港上市的中国股票周三走高，延续了刺激政策引发的涨势，因为交易员们从公众假期中返回。【原文：Chinese shares listed in Hong Kong advanced Wednesday, extending a stimulus-induced rally as traders returned from a public holiday.】

item.title: 比特币在代币历史最佳月份的糟糕开局中下挫
item.description: 随着中东紧张局势的加剧，全球市场开始谨慎，寄希望于十月季节性熔断的比特币投机者面临着提前的现实检查。【原文：Bitcoin speculators banking on a seasonal October meltup face an early reality check as deepening tension in the Middle East drives a bout of caution across global markets.】

item.title: 甲骨文将向马来西亚人工智能和云服务枢纽投资65亿美元
item.description: 甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp. ）计划斥资 65 亿美元在马来西亚建设云服务中心，成为最新一家投资东南亚人工智能基础设施的全球科技公司。【原文：Oracle Corp. plans to spend $6.5 billion building a cloud services center in Malaysia, becoming the latest global tech name to invest in Southeast Asian AI infrastructure.】

item.title: 日本公司抢滩美元基金，超越全球同行
item.description: 在投资者为货币政策分化做好准备之际，日本公司正急于出售美元债券，这是今年主要经济体中发行量增幅最大的国家之一。【原文：Companies in Japan are rushing to sell dollar bonds, marking one of the biggest increases in issuance this year among major economies as investors brace for diverging monetary policy.】

item.title: 中国重回新兴市场主导地位，MSCI 权重飙升
item.description: 在短短八天内，中国重新夺回了其在新兴市场失去的长达 10 个月的影响力。【原文：In just eight days, China regained the influence it lost over 10 months in emerging markets.】

item.title: 前红杉印度公司降低收费，缩减最新基金规模
item.description: 由于估值飙升使交易更难完成，尤其是在印度，Peak XV Partners（前红杉资本的一部分）正在将其最新的增长基金减少 4.65 亿美元，并削减其他基金的费用。【原文：Peak XV Partners, formerly part of Sequoia Capital, is reducing its latest growth fund by $465 million and cutting fees on other funds as soaring valuations make it harder to complete deals, especially in India.】

item.title: 港股随波幅波动，多头注意了
item.description: 连续六天，香港基准股票指数和跟踪期权成本的指标同向波动。上一次出现这种情况时，恒生指数在两个月左右的时间里飙升了 30%。【原文：For six straight days, Hong Kong’s benchmark stocks gauge and a measure tracking the cost of its options moved in the same direction. The last time that happened, the Hang Seng Index went on to surge 30% in about two months.】

item.title: 中国股市上涨导致美国上市股票空头损失 70 亿美元
item.description: 据 S3 Partners 的一份报告称，由刺激政策推动的中国股市大幅上涨，已使押注美国上市股票的交易商损失了约 69 亿美元的按市价计算的损失。【原文：The dramatic stimulus-fueled rally in Chinese stocks has cost traders betting against US-listed shares roughly $6.9 billion in mark-to-market losses, according to a report from S3 Partners.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好波音公司考虑筹资至少 100 亿美元。三星正在亚太地区裁员。雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）称中国刺激市场的举措可能成为转折点。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. Boeing considers raising at least $10 billion. Samsung is laying off workers in Asia-Pacific. Ray Dalio says China’s surge of market stimulus may be turning point. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 一场激烈的争斗有可能使价值 110 亿美元的金属帝国分崩离析
item.description: 韩国两个富裕家族为争夺一个价值 110 亿美元的锌矿帝国的未来而大打出手，最终演变成一场激烈的控制权争夺战，这可能会阻碍实现全球能源过渡金属供应多样化的努力。【原文：A spat between two wealthy South Korean families over the future of an $11 billion zinc empire has descended into a bitter battle for control that could hamper efforts to diversify the global supply of energy-transition metals.】

item.title: 零售房东 FrontView REIT 据称将在首次公开募股中筹资 2.51 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，FrontView 房地产投资信托公司（FrontView REIT Inc.【原文：FrontView REIT Inc., a landlord that focuses on businesses with stores in prominent locations, raised $250.8 million in an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中东局势升级刺激避风港需求，黄金价格接近历史纪录
item.description: 由于以色列承诺对伊朗的导弹袭击进行报复，市场对中东冲突升级进行了评估，黄金保持上涨，接近历史高点。【原文：Gold held an advance that put it close to an all-time high, with markets assessing the escalation of conflict in the Middle East as Israel pledged to retaliate against Iran’s missile strikes.】

item.title: 香港高管继承 SenseTime 15 亿美元股权
item.description: 香港证券交易所的一位高管从她已故的丈夫那里继承了SenseTime集团公司价值超过10亿美元的股份，成为这家中国人工智能巨头的最大股东。【原文：An executive at Hong Kong’s stock exchange has inherited a stake worth more than $1 billion in SenseTime Group Inc. from her late husband, making her the largest shareholder in the Chinese artificial intelligence giant.】

item.title: 对冲基金大举进军中国，寻求各种途径获取风险敞口
item.description: 对冲基金正以创纪录的速度涌入中国股市，因为他们押注中国政府的经济刺激政策将加速陷入困境的中国经济复苏。【原文：Hedge funds are piling into Chinese stocks at a record pace on bets Beijing’s stimulus blitz will speed up the recovery of the nation’s struggling economy.】

item.title: 以色列袭击伊朗后誓言报复，石油价格继续飙升
item.description: 伊朗向以色列发射了约200枚弹道导弹，引来以色列总理本雅明-内塔尼亚胡誓言报复，并增加了原油供应的风险，此后石油连续第二天飙升。【原文：Oil surged for a second day after Iran fired about 200 ballistic missiles at Israel, drawing a vow of retaliation from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and raising the risks to crude supplies.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击以色列后，石油引领避险天堂走高：市场综述
item.description: 在伊朗向以色列发射了一连串导弹后，石油带动了避险资产的飙升，美国股市周二也因避险情绪而走低。【原文：Oil led a surge in haven assets after Iran fired a barrage of missiles at Israel, with the flight to safety sending US stocks lower on Tuesday.】

item.title: 日本 4 万亿美元 "套利交易 "开始缓慢平仓
item.description: 日本投资者开始失去对海外资产长达数十年的迷恋。【原文：Japan’s investors are starting to lose their decades-long infatuation with overseas assets.】

item.title: S&P公司因冲突 "越来越有可能 "加剧而裁员以色列
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司下调了以色列的评级，该评级公司认为以色列与真主党的冲突 "越来越有可能加剧"。【原文：Israel was downgraded by S&P Global Ratings amid what the ratings firm sees as “an increasing likelihood” that the conflict with Hezbollah intensifies.】

item.title: 以色列对伊朗导弹的空中防御是什么？
item.description: 以色列以拥有世界上最好的防空系统而自豪，但这些价值数十亿美元的系统正在经受考验。自伊朗支持的巴勒斯坦组织哈马斯于 10 月 7 日挑起与以色列的新战争以来，伊朗支持的其他激进组织也纷纷加入，向以色列发射火箭弹、导弹和无人机。伊朗自己也发动了两次袭击，最近一次是在 10 月 1 日，发射了大约 200 枚导弹。【原文：Israel prides itself on having some of the best air defenses in the world, but these billion-dollar systems are being tested. Since the Iran-backed Palestinian group Hamas provoked a new war with Israel on Oct. 7, other militant organizations supported by Iran have joined in, launching rockets, missiles and drones at Israel. Iran itself has struck twice, most recently on Oct. 1 with a barrage of roughly 200 missiles.】

item.title: Ares 接近收购 Form Technologies，融资 10 亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：Jefferies Financial Group Inc. is in early discussions with investors on a roughly $1 billion financing package to support Ares Management Corp.’s potential buyout of industrial manufacturer Form Technologies from Partners Group Holding AG, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利寻求撤销私募股权公司提出的 7.5 亿美元诉讼
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）要求法官驳回两家私募股权公司的诉讼，这两家公司声称，他们在摩根士丹利向 Fortress 投资集团（Fortress Investment Group）支持的高铁运营商提供贷款的投资中被骗走了 7.5 亿美元。【原文：Morgan Stanley asked a judge to toss a suit by two private equity firms that claim they were cheated out of $750 million in an investment in the bank’s loans to a Fortress Investment Group-backed high-speed rail operator.】

item.title: Contact Energy 称与 Manawa 的合并计划不会削弱竞争
item.description: 新西兰电力公司 Contact Energy 在向反垄断监管机构提交的许可申请中称，该公司与 Manawa Energy 的拟议合并不会大幅削弱任何市场的竞争。【原文：New Zealand power company Contact Energy said its proposed merger with Manawa Energy won’t substantially lessen competition in any market, according to a clearance application submitted to the antitrust regulator.】

item.title: 穆迪上调评级后，巴西即将获得投资级评级
item.description: 穆迪评级公司将巴西的信用等级上调至最高的垃圾级，并将强劲的经济增长和改革记录作为上调评级的理由。【原文：Brazil’s credit score was raised to the highest junk grade by Moody’s Ratings, which cited robust economic growth and a track record of reforms as reasons for the upgrade.】

item.title: 减息幅度较小，交易员解除国债多头押注
item.description: 债券交易商开始兑现他们对美国国债进一步反弹的押注，因为他们缩减了对美联储将再次降息半个百分点的预期。【原文：Bond traders are beginning to cash out of their bets for a further rally in US Treasuries as they scale back on expectations the Federal Reserve will deliver another half-point interest-rate cut.】
